name: SANTA RITA Fast Foods & Cafe (Goan Portuguese Cuisine)

reviews.review_text: The food here is authentic Goan/ Portuguese and feels home made. The snacks are made fresh, once ordered. We enjoyed the prawn chops, beef samosas and prawn samosas. We had an awesome family lunch.. we went with 3 of their recommend dishes..the beef cebolado, pork solantulem and sausage pulao.. all were amazing.. the beef and pork were so well cooked..i cut the meat using a spoon... not oily... superb food.

I've visited this café multiple times and have always enjoyed the food, but I had a disappointing experience on my most recent visit. I decided to dine in, and unfortunately, the service was slow — my order of 2 croquettes and 2 beef chops took over an hour to prepare. When the food finally arrived, the beef chops were stale and cold, not at all what I had come to expect.

I don’t want to damage the reputation of your brand, but I think it’s important to be honest and share my experience. Hopefully, this can help improve the service for future customers.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Another cozy place located in the internal part of the outskirts of Panjim in Odlem bhaat Taleigao. Probably one amongst the few rare remaining places dishing up some traditional Goan Portuguese food in and around the Panjim city limits, it may feel a little heavier on the pockets for those who prefer the gaado style cutlet paos etc, but the coziness and ambience is worth that little extra premium. And ofcourse the food too is right up there like the good old glory days.
